Module com.example.c42project
Package com.example.c42project

Class modifyProductController

java.lang.Object
com.example.c42project.modifyProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class modifyProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class allows a user to modify an existing Product.
Author:
Zachary Hoppock

    This method initializes the Modify Product window of the application, including displaying all the parts from the Parts list and displaying the current attribute values and associated parts of the selected product.

    This method runs through all the text fields to check if any input validation errors occurred.

    This method allows the user to select a part from the upper part table and click Add to add it to the product's associated parts list.
    void

    This method sends you back to the main menu if you click the Cancel button, warning you of any changes to be lost if you do so.

    onActionRemoveAssocPart()
    This method will allow you to remove a selected part from the lower Parts table if you click the Remove Associated Part button.
    void
    onActionSaveProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method will return to the main menu with the updated selected Product if you click the Save button, granted all text fields have valid input.
    void
    onInputSearchParts()
    This method allows the user to search for a specific part(s) by either a character, name, or ID number in the search field.

  • Method Details

    • callDirectory

      public void callDirectory(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method is used to transfer back to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      event - used to signify that a certain button was pressed
      Throws:
      IOException - an I/O exception may be thrown if there is an issue executing a file

    • getSelectedProduct

      public static void getSelectedProduct(Product selectedProduct, int index)
      This method retrieves the attribute values and list index of the selected product from the main menu's product table.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - the product that was selected to be modified
      index - the list index of the selected part

    • inputValidation

      public boolean inputValidation(String name, String stock, String price, String min, String max)
      This method runs through all the text fields to check if any input validation errors occurred.
      Parameters:
      name - the text value in the name field
      stock - the text value in the stock field
      price - the text value in the price field
      min - the text value in the min field
      max - the text value in the max field
      Returns:
      whether it is 'true' that all the text fields have valid input or not

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the Modify Product window of the application, including displaying all the parts from the Parts list and displaying the current attribute values and associated parts of the selected product.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - a standard parameter when running JavaFX initialization
      resourceBundle - a standard parameter when running JavaFX initialization

    • onInputSearchParts

      public void onInputSearchParts()
      This method allows the user to search for a specific part(s) by either a character, name, or ID number in the search field.

    • onActionAddAssocPart

      public void onActionAddAssocPart()
      This method allows the user to select a part from the upper part table and click Add to add it to the product's associated parts list. A warning window will pop up if no part is selected.

    • onActionRemoveAssocPart

      public void onActionRemoveAssocPart()
      This method will allow you to remove a selected part from the lower Parts table if you click the Remove Associated Part button. A warning window will pop up asking if you wish to proceed in removing the associated part from the product. A warning window will pop up if no part is selected.

    • onActionCancel

      public void onActionCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method sends you back to the main menu if you click the Cancel button, warning you of any changes to be lost if you do so.
      Parameters:
      event - the Action Event of pressing the Cancel button
      Throws:
      IOException - an I/O exception may be thrown if there is an issue executing a file

    • onActionSaveProduct

      public void onActionSaveProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method will return to the main menu with the updated selected Product if you click the Save button, granted all text fields have valid input.
      Parameters:
      event - the Action Event of pressing the Save button
      Throws:
      IOException - an I/O exception may be thrown if there is an issue executing a file
